#Text=French workers use threats in compensation demand
#Text=Friday , July 17 , 2009
#Text=Following similar threats by workers at New Fabris and Nortel , workers at JLG in Tonneins , France , threatened to blow up several platform cranes .
#Text=The JLG factory announced in April 2009 that it will fire 53 of its 163 workers by the end of 2009 , while the remaining 110 jobs will not be secure over the next 2 years .
#Text=JLG Tonneins was acquired in 2006 with its parent JLG Industries , a maker of aerial work platforms , by the U.S. -based Oshkosh Corporation .
#Text=Despite being hugely profitable in the past , production has been much reduced since 2008 with the contraction of the construction industry and lower demand for its products .
#Text=Despite excellent past results the new American management demanded sweeping cuts at the company .

#Text=In the view of locals , " the company 's actions are a disgrace given the expensive perks , such as official cars , for its corporate fat cats , compared to the sacrifice , silence , and dignity demanded by the company of those it has made redundant . "

column1: #Text=The management offered severance pay of € 3,000 ( US $ 4,200 ) , however the workers demanded a severance package commensurate with " the wealth that their labor has generated . "
#Text=Worker 's delegates requested a " supra-legal " payment of € 30,000 , on Thursday 16 of July the management responded with a counter offer of € 16,000 .
#Text=On Thursday night the worker 's actions secured the € 30,000 settlement initially demanded .
#Text=Interview :
#Text=A JLG Tonneins worker who wished to stay anonymous spoke to Wikinews .
#Text=Can you explain what inspired the workers at JLG to make these threats ?
#Text=Photograph of the threatened machines , Tonneins , France .
#Text=( Photo credit : Public domain photograph provided by a Tonniens worker )
#Text=After four months of negotiations with very little progress , we saw the need for a media coup in our dispute .
#Text=Similar threats in recent disputes , reported by the mainstream media , have proven to be productive .
#Text=We were spurred on by redundancy pay of 3,000 Euro , derisory in view of the wealth that our labour has generated in previous years and the threat that these lay-offs pose to our families .

#Text=Responsibility must also lie with the refusal by the management , these last four months , to negotiate an appropriate severance package ; the movement in our company has therefore resorted to the media with a visually striking example .
#Text=Machines designed and built at our workshops were therefore surrounded by two and four canisters of gas .
#Text=The visual effect was created .
#Text=You have demanded a large severance payment .
#Text=In the context of the crisis in the building industry , can JLG afford it ?

#Text=JLG is part of the Oshkosh Corporation , the group brought JLG in 2007 because of its very good economic health , 2006 was a very good year , and the fiscal year of 2007-2008 was excellent for JLG , our best figures ever .
#Text=So yes , with regards to the figures for 2007-2008 the results to come 2009 , 2010 are very poor .
#Text=But only in comparison with exceptionally profitable years !
#Text=The crisis appears to be a belt-tightening one .
#Text=This is not the optimal solution , almost exclusively the solution chosen is to lay off technicians and employees at the sites , when they are the least expensive [ part of the work force ] .
#Text=Yes , JLG France has other ways to better manage this crisis .
#Text=This would require that all tighten their belts , which does not appear to be the strategy chosen by the management .
#Text=Hence the accumulation of tension in the company .
